item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.

item.title: How to make a deck of cards in R
item.description: I want to make a deck of cards. Here is how I do it. First we need to understand the elements of the deck of cards. There are 4 different suits, 13 different values, and 13 different faces. Make the suits in order by naming the four suits and listing them 13 times so that all 3 lists are the same length. Make the faces by listing out all 13 and we can duplicate it from there.

item.title: How to see proportions in data using R
item.description: Seeing the proportion of the whole is a valuable visualization when looking at different segments. Recently I was asked to explore the differences between two audiences and using the proportion charts were incredibly telling. The ability to quickly identify if there could be differences between two groups and then identify what the difference is, can help anyone in their data exploration process in addition to telling the story.

item.title: Second Post from the rest
item.description: This is the second of the many posts. 400 is the number of posts I have set for a goal this year. I have only 150 days left and therefore I need to publish 2.6666667 posts per day. library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.0 ── ## ✓ ggplot2 3.3.3 ✓ purrr 0.3.4 ## ✓ tibble 3.0.6 ✓ dplyr 1.0.4 ## ✓ tidyr 1.1.2 ✓ stringr 1.4.0 ## ✓ readr 1.
